title.narrative: Camp Coordination and Camp Management , Direct Life-Saving and Protection Assistance for Affected Populations in Displacement Sites in Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo

description.narrative: Through the provision of life-saving assistance and protection to Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) residing in North-Kivu and Tanganyika (DRC), IOM will directly contribute to improving the living conditions of people affected by the crisis: 1. collecting, analyzing and sharing data on displacement flows and locations, number of IDPs and returnees and their needs, for a targeted humanitarian planning and response by all humanitarian and government partners; 2. IOM will continue to maintain its presence in the recognized displacement sites in North-Kivu and will extend site management services to the new spontaneous displacement sites in North-Kivu, Tanganyika and Ituri; 3. The most vulnerable IDPs in displacement sites, host communities and return areas will be targeted for the provision of emergency assistance in the Shelter, NFI and WASH sectors; 4. Ensure the protection of those affected by the crisis and avoid forced relocation and/or secondary displacement, IOM will reinforce community-based protection networks in displacement sites and provide tailored assistance to survivors of Gender Based Violence (GBV), victims of trafficking and to the most vulnerable IDPs at risk of exploitation and/or abuse.
